      • generateDecisionTree

      • makeSubTree

        private DtNode makeSubTree(java.lang.Integer minInstances,
                 DataSet data,
                 Attribute attribute,
                 java.lang.Double value,
                 java.lang.Integer relation,
                 java.util.ArrayList<Attribute> availableAttributes)
        A recursive method that returns a node that roots a subtree of the decision tree given a subset of training instances, and a set of attributes that are available to use in order to split the instances.
        Parameters:
        minInstances - - the stopping criteria for the recursion is met when the minimum number of instances reaches this node
        data - - a data set of training instances that will be used to construct the subtree
        attribute - - the attribute that the root node should test
        value - - the value of the attribute the root node should test
        relation - - how an instances attribute is compared to the root node's value See for valid relations
        availableAttributes - - a list of available attributes that are available to split the training instances
        Returns:
        the root of the subtree

      • removeAttributeById

        private java.util.ArrayList<Attribute> removeAttributeById(java.util.ArrayList<Attribute> currAttributes,
                                                 java.lang.Integer attrId)
        A helper method for removing an attribute with a specific attribute ID from an ArrayList of Attributes
        Parameters:
        currAttributes - ArrayList of Attributes from which we wish to remove an Attribute
        attrId - the ID of the Attribute we wish to remove
        Returns:

      • checkStoppingCriteria

        private java.lang.Boolean checkStoppingCriteria(DataSet data,
                                      int minInstances,
                                      java.util.ArrayList<Attribute> availableAttributes,
                                      java.util.ArrayList<Split> candidateSplits)
        Check for the decision-tree stopping criteria given a data set of instances. The stopping criteria is achieved if one of the following holds true: 1. All candidate splits have negative information gain 2. There are no more available attributes to split on 3. The number of instances at the node is less than or equal to our threshold 4. All instances at this node are of the same class
        Parameters:
        data - - a data set that holds a subset of the training set
        minInstances - - if the number of instances in the data set at the current node is less than or equal to the this argument, than the stopping criteria has been reached
        Returns:

      • getMajorityClass

        private java.lang.Integer getMajorityClass(DataSet data)
